basic.floral_language:
Echeveria 'Perle von Nurnberg'
Floriography: beautiful, mysterious, precious
A beautiful succulent, leaves closely arranged in a spiral rosette, center leaves are in pink-purple color, and the outer layer leaves are white, leaf surface has a layer of white powders, with low sunlight, leaf color become green, reducing its ornamental value. 
Likes sunshine, place under scattered light in summer, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, white or pink color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green to fuchsia, when sunny leaves more colorful

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, shade properly under summer strong light, no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
